title: Lazarus of Bethany
summary: Saint Lazarus of Bethany (Latinised ultimately from the Aramaic: אלעזר, Elʿāzār, cf. Heb. Eleazar, "God helped"), also venerated as Righteous Lazarus, the Four-Days Dead in the Eastern Orthodox Church,[4] is the subject of a prominent sign of Jesus in the Gospel of John, in which Jesus restores him to life four days after his death. The Eastern Orthodox and Catholic traditions offer varying accounts of the later events of his life.
